definitions: (of something lost) able to be regained or retrieved

examples.text: even unreadable disks may contain information that is recoverable

shortDefinitions: able to be regained or retrieved

definitions: (of compensation or money spent or lost) able to be regained or secured by means of a legal process or subsequent profits

examples.text: damages are recoverable for breaches of the EC competition rules

shortDefinitions: able to be regained or secured by means of legal process

definitions: (of an energy source or a supply of it) able to be economically extracted from the ground or sea

examples.text: the target increase in recoverable oil and gas reserves

shortDefinitions: (of energy source) able to be economically extracted from ground or sea
